body.name: ALLDOCUBE Android 13 Tablet, 16GB (8+8) RAM 256GB ROM 512GB Expandable Android Tablet, Helio G99 8-Core CPU, 1920 * 1200 IPS in-Cell 8.4 inch Tablet iPlay 50 Mini Pro, 5000mAh, 5MP/13MP, 4G LTE

features: 【MTK Helio G99 & Android 13】The iPlay 50 Mini Pro tablet is equipped with the MTK Helio G99 chip, ensuring smooth gaming experiences without any lag.The Mali G57 MC2 graphics chip supports advanced graphics technologies, combined with the Android 13 system and GMS certification, allowing you to download a variety of applications from the Google Play store.

【Immersive Visual Experience】Measuring 8.4 inches with a resolution of 1920 ×1200 FHD, this android tablet delivers an optimal video viewing experience that brings every detail to life. The slim and compact design of 202.7 x 126 x 7.5 mm and a weight of 306 grams combined with In-Cell technology ensures responsive and smooth touch operation. 20 nits of brightness and vivid contrast let you enjoy the beauty of vivid images.

【Expandable Memory】 The tablet has 16GB of RAM (8+8 virtual memory) 256GB of internal storage, which can be expanded to 512GB using an SD card. This makes it easy to store large amounts of data and media. Fast UFS 2.1 storage also ensures smooth data reads and file transfers - no more lag!

【Versatile Connectivity】 iPlay 50 Mini Pro tablet stays connected wherever you are. It supports 4G LTE, GPS, 2.4/5GHZ Wi-Fi and Bluetooth 5.2 to ensure a fast and stable connection. It also supports wireless projection, allowing you to share your screen wirelessly for a seamless and convenient experience. In addition, the 5MP front camera and 13MP rear camera can be used for a variety of applications from landscape photography to telecommuting and online classes.

【Long-lasting Battery】 The iPlay 50 Mini Pro android tablet is powered by a 5000mAh battery, providing you with the endurance you need for work, entertainment, and more. The PD 18W fast charging allows you to quickly recharge your tablet. Please note that the included charger is 5V2A and the PD 18W charger is not included.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: The iPlay 50 mini pro tablet adopts a 1920×1200 resolution FHD+ narrow edge screen with eye protection, displaying gorgeous HD in all viewing angles and bringing you vivid images. This 8.4-inch tablet is perfect for users looking for a portable, compact device. Its size is so portable that it is comfortable to carry in one hand or in a small bag. It strikes the perfect balance between portability and functionality, making it ideal for people on the go.

MTK Helio G99 Octa-core Chip This android tablet adopts 6nm advanced process, high energy and low consumption, and the new version of AnTuTu score exceeds 40W. There are also multiple underlying smoothness optimization to bring you a speedy response. Whether it's for online classes, catching up on dramas or brushing short videos, you can enjoy the smoothness, and it's also easy to play big games during leisure time. Stay Connected and Explore It's a small tablet and a big phone. Support 4G LTE frequency band:GSM：B2/3/5/8, WCDMA：B1/2/5/8, FDD:B1/2/3/4/5/7/8/20/28AB/66 TDD: B38/39/40/41.(B12 band is not supported and may not be available in some areas, T-Mobile is recommended) It allows you to be online and enjoy the fun of the mobile Internet anytime, anywhere, and supports VoLTE HD calling function, through which you can easily realize 4G full network connectivity. 13MP HD Rear Camera Sharper shooting, More vivid recording The iPlay 50 mini pro android tablet 5MP front-facing camera is perfect for high-quality video calls, and the 13MP rear-facing camera lets you capture every moment with superior detail and clarity. WiFi 5.2 Tablet Project the screen as you like This android tablet utilizes the latest WiFi 5.2 technology to provide a faster and more stable wireless connection. Whether you're watching a movie, playing a game or presenting your work content, you can cast the screen in a seamless way. All you need to do is connect the tablet to a TV, projector or other device to enjoy a larger, clearer picture, making entertainment and work more convenient and comfortable.

Small tablet, Large capacity, High performance 16GB + 256GB iPlay 50 mini pro tablet is equipped with 8GB of operating memory, expandable 8GB of virtual memory, a total of 16GB of fusion of large memory, to bring a better use of the experience, so that you can easily switch between more apps smoother, goodbye to lag, enjoy the speed and smoothness. 256G large-capacity high-speed UFS storage, music, photos, movies, so that you will no longer be anxious about the lack of memory. GMS Certified Free to download apps Equipped with the latest Android 13 operating system, this tablet is GMS certified and offers a large selection of apps and games. The intuitive interface and smooth performance enhance the productivity and entertainment experience, allowing you to multitask and switch between apps with ease. GPS+Beidou+Glonass+Galileo The tablet supports the GPS, Beidou, Glonass and Galileo navigation systems. With the support of these four navigation systems, the tablet provides users with a comprehensive and seamless navigation experience, no matter where they are or where they are traveling to.

ALLDOCUBE iPlay 50 Mini Pro Specifications CPU MTK Helio G99 8-Core（2 x ARM Cortex-A76 + 6 x ARM Cortex-A55） System Android 13 Screen Size 8.4 inches, 1920 ×1200 FHD, In-Cell, 320nits RAM 16GB (8+8 Virtual) ROM 256GB (512GB Expandable) Size & Weight 202.7 x 126 x 7.5 mm, 306g Camera Front 5MP+Rear 13MP Bluetooth Bluetooth5.2 WiFi 2.4GHz/5GHz 802.11 ac/a/b/g/n Network standard GSM: B2/3/5/8, WCDMA: B1/2/5/8, FDD: B1/2/3/5/7/8/20/28AB, TDD: B38/40/41 Navigation GPS/Beidou/Galileo/Glonass Charging Method Type-C (5V/2A OR PD18W) Battery 5000mAh

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best 8” tablet that doesn’t come from that other $$$ company that starts with an “A”
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I spent the past year designing a mounting device that allows small screen tablets and my own 9” IPS screen for PCs called the ‘Gaming Lens’, but sadly at the start of this quest there was only one tablet that had enough BEEF to handle game streaming and AAA converted titles like “Alien Isolation” and that was from Apple with their iPad Mini 6th generation which will set you back $500 (lowest tier model) push you into their ecosystem, and frankly a 4:3 ratio screen that waste a lot of screen real estate for most 16:9 formatted games. There are a few 8” tablets from Samsung & Lenovo, but they have limited RAM & storage, are slow and on the cheap side as well as only having a 1280x800 screen. Lenovo also makes a 8.8” tablet called the Legion but it was never brought to the US market and it too costs about the $500.Then out of nowhere Alldocube releases not one, but two 8” 1920x1200 IPS screen based tablets. One you can buy for about $80 (with coupon) and this one that you can buy for $160 (with coupon) here on Amazon, and have it next day. The former has 1/2 the memory, and 1/4 the storage of the latter, which is of a slower variant, and much slower processor, but it does share WiFi 5, BT 5 & even 4G LTE (with additional SIM & service) making it an excellent tablet for media/game streaming, and with its 4GB or RAM it can even run ‘Alien Isolation’ but is a little laggy and stutters on occasion (See my review on Amazon).This tablet has 8GB of RAM, a much faster 256GB storage option, and most important — it uses the MediaTek Helio G99, which clocks in 2-4 times faster in CPU/GPU tests than their lower cost model. Making, ‘Alien Isolation’, Half-Life 2, Doom 3 and even the more recent Fortnite run without problems at mostly “high” settings. Since it actually uses a Google certified copy of Android, I had no problem installing anything there, as well as side loading Fortnite, Alien Isolation, Half-Life 2, Portal and the app that allows you to run the PC version of Doom 3, as well many MODs. As mentioned already it has WIFI 5, BT 5, and a 4G/LTE modem. I popped in my Google Fi DATA SIM, which to my surprise even works pretty well for Game streaming using the XBOX Game Pass, and to lesser quality experience NVIDIA NOW. WiFi 5 is more than adequate to run these services as well, but I would have paid few dollars more to have WiFi 6 to cover all my bases. Still, Wifi 5 on this tablet is no slouch and was never the problem in using cloud gaming services, or local services from NVIDIA, AMD, Steam, or the public domain streaming server — Sunshine using Moonlight or Steam Link.Another important aspect for me was weight. Coming in at 305g, just a 7g less than the lower cost model and 5g less than the iPad Mini. IT IS PERFECT for my ‘Gaming Lens’ mount, that allows you to “float” it above a Sony DS4, Dualsense or XBOX controller for perfect balance. Since it uses the gamepad you are already familiar with and the fact it can be connected via USB, it makes this ALLDOCUBE tablet a JOY TO USE due to its sharp crisp screen, with it deep blacks & saturated color. Of course at this price you are not getting Variable Refresh Rate, but frankly most Android games can’t even keep up at 60 FPS, which is also your limit with cloud services, and in my opinion a waste on small format device. Speaking of small format devices. By combining my ‘Gaming Lens’, ALLDOCUBE IPlay 50 and a decent PC, you can save yourself few hundred on those far more expensive small format gaming system like the Steamdeck, ASUS ROG Ally, Lenovo Legion Go and other variants from lesser known companies where $700 is the price you are going to pay for one of these for the mid to high tier versions. Just add the MoonLight or Steam Link app, a decent WiFi router/access point with your PC connected to it via a LAN cable and you should see decent if not great performance. You can even connect using the ‘SuperDisplay’ app over USB for “tether” performance, which works quite well using a dual USB cable setup; one for the tablet, and one for the controller. This option works really well for mini PCs like those from MinisForum, that can also be used as tiny screen, push come to shove.In summary, this is almost a perfect 8” tablet: Great price, excellent 1920x1200 screen, loads of RAM & storage, medium/high CPU/Performance (about Snapdragon 640 level), decent WiFi & BT, and BUILT-IN 4G/LTE! Oh and I almost forgot one other feature that sets it apart from its cheaper sibling and other low-cost 8” tablets — FAST CHARGING! Yep 18W PD Fast, and battery life was also better, but I have not actually done any drain tests yet to determine how long it will last on charge, but I’d say running it all day, today with the apps mentioned above for about 6 hours continuous, it still says I have 36% left. The questions will be. How long will it last? Fit & finish decent. Aluminum body and similar look to the iPad mini 6th gen, just a narrower and tad thicker.Oh there is one thing, I wish they could have done and that is add two speakers, but if I had to choose, between this and a few more gs, I can live without it. Especially since you don’t need any special dongles to plug in a standard pair of headphones. Yep, 1/8th mini jack (and why it is a little thicker than the iPad Mini) available and in the right spot when using it landscape, 2 THUMBS Up just for thinking ahead on that little feature.Note: The launcher used is 3rd party and can be purchased for five bucks in the PlayStore. Look for “Console Launcher.” Well worth the $4.99.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great tablet that won't break the bank
reviews.reviewText: I wanted a new tablet. I’ve been a true-blue Android guy since it was invented, but after hearing so much raving about the greatness of Apple and its tablets I decided to give Apple a try. I popped $850 to buy the latest and greatest iPad Pro. I really thought I’d love it. For sure, the iPad Pro is a quality, well-built product, but I just didn’t much care for iOS to the point that, after two months of disappointing and declining use, I sold it. Also, I found the iPad Pro (with case) to be annoying heavy and clunky - not exactly the portable experience I wanted in a tablet.So, now I still needed a tablet, but, for sure, it wouldn’t be Apple. However, shopping for a decent Android tablet is an eye opener. Manufacturers are simply not interested in the tablet market and it shows. From reading reviews, there are a lot of low-end junk Android tablets out there and a lot of disappointed buyers. (Yes, Samsung make good tablets but they’re very pricey.) I was disillusioned and almost decided to forget about buying a tablet after all when I stumbled upon the ALLDOCUBE iPlay 50 Mini Pro on Amazon. I was impressed with the specs.For the price, you get a lot of bang for the buck. The processor, RAM, memory capacity and standard features on this tablet blew away competing tablets by far. My order was delivered quickly. I can honestly say I enjoy my iPlay 50 Mini Pro much more than the $850 iPad, although I still shake me head when I see the name ALLDOCUBE at boot up. (Note to marketing: Spend more time on a name!)I’m not a gamer, but for my everyday needs, the iPlay 50 Mini Pro is very responsive. The unit is lightweight, but still feels sturdy. The screen is bright and clear. Battery life is excellent – much better than the iPad Pro.The tablet came with Android 13 installed and it works fine. I’ve had no issues. The setup process simply cloned my apps and data from my Android phone and the tablet was in use immediately. (Note: If you happen to use the Nova Launcher, Nova will exactly duplicate your home screens, icon positions, backgrounds, etc. on your new tablet! Highly recommended over any stock launcher.)Of course, there are a few minor gripes with the iPlay 50. The power and volume buttons are frustratingly too close together and very hard to differentiate. I’m constantly groping and always pressing the wrong one. Also, there is only one speaker and the audio quality is only fair.Bottom line, this tablet has a lot to offer and I’m happy I bought it. I have a great everyday tablet and it didn’t break the bank.

Il dispositivo è molto solido e compatto, acquistato come tablet da battaglia da viaggio e devo dire che mi sono ritrovato in più circostanze ad utilizzare questo al posto di altri tablet in mio possesso più costosi e di brand molto conosciuti.Lo schermo è veramente ben definito, con bei colori ed una ottima luminosità, il touch è molto preciso e reattivoLe prestazioni sono quasi da top di gamma per un utilizzo normale, provato anche qualche gioco e con settaggi grafici modesti sono più che utilizzabiliGli 8 GB di RAM fanno davvero la differenza, la maggior parte delle app le trovo ancora aperte a distanza di ore. La batteria dura tranquillamente tutto il giorno usandolo tanto, in ogni caso con un buon caricatore si riesce a portare dal 50 al 100% in un'oretta.La connessione 4G è presente e prende sempre bene il segnale, tuttavia (per i più esperti) non aggrega più bande in 4G, perciò la velocità di connessione è piuttosto bassa in zone molto affollate (si naviga comunque benissimo, ma per scaricare file grossi ci potrebbe volere più tempo)Supporta l'estensione della memoria di sistema con micro SD (fondendo lo spazio e quindi potendoci installare ulteriori app) ma avendo già 256gb conviene usare la micro SD come memoria portatile per eventuali film in modo da non rischiare perdita di dati in caso di rotturaLe patch di sicurezza a quanto pare vengono rilasciate (non scontato quando si tratta di brand emergenti) e ad oggi 11/01/24 sono aggiornate a novembre 2023.Nel complesso ineguagliabile in questa fascia di prezzo, modelli di brand più conosciuti in questa fascia vendono soltanto porcherie

Me ha encantado esta tableta, la he comprado para trastear con diferentes roms de Android y demás, al final le he dejado la rom original y le he activado la memoria ampliada, la uso para emuladores tiene un rendimiento ideal. No le hice root ni nada raro, todo original.Pros:Es rápida y se le puede configurar en cualquier idioma.Android 13 con algún tweak para lo de la memoria, todo integrado dentro de la misma ROM oficial.elocidad para juegos de emuladores excelente.Buen material al tacto.La Rom instalada viene de serie con GAPPS(Google applications) es una gran noticia porque te ahorra el tener que instalar todo lo de Google.Contras:Sonido, pffff, debería tener 2 altavoces.Notas de mi compra en particular:Una cosa que no me ha gustado es que no estaba sellada y parece como si la hubiesen devuelto y luego me la enviaron a mi como nueva, en fin.Otro punto a destacar que me ha desquiciado es que el cable USB es banco y el cargador negro, esto creo que es un punto en el diseño del producto que se debería unificar o todo negro o todo blanco, no sé a lo mejor soy yo muy exigente .

Es ist ein top Tablet, habe lange ein 8 Zoll gesucht, jetzt habe ich es. Klein, leicht, super Display, schnell,gute Kamera, sehr gute Verarbeitung. Ein kleines Manko ist der Lautsprecher, aber kann man bei der sonstigen Qualität und bei dem Preis verschmerzen. Wer ein gutes 8 Zoll Tablet sucht ---kaufen---

Packaging sobre mais bien fini.Mise en route aisée.Prise en main facile.Performances au rendez-vous. La tablette répond rapidement et ne lag pas. il y a plus performant mais c'est nettement plus cher.Côté son, c'est moyen mais, bon, c'est une tablette 8 pouces. Il suffit d'y connecter un bon système audio BT et le tour est joué.Qualité d'affichage plutôt plaisante (écran lumineux, résolution parfaitement adaptée).Jouabilité bonne (mais je ne l'ai pas acheté pour le jeu).Caméra très correcte pour ce type de tablette.C'est globalement un bon choix.
